meanings.definition: To form a series of small curves or indentations along an edge or surface.
meanings.sent1: She was scolloping the paper to make it look fancy.
meanings.sent2: The baker was scolloping the pie crust for decoration.
meanings.sent3: The artist scolloped the clay into a unique shape.
meanings.sent4: The wind scolloped the sand dunes along the beach.
meanings.sent5: The tailor scolloped the dress hem beautifully.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting or shaping with a curved or scalloped edge.
meanings.sent1: The scolloping on the fabric added a nice touch to the design.
meanings.sent2: She admired the delicate scolloping on the lace trim.
meanings.sent3: The scolloping tool made crafting easier and more fun.
meanings.sent4: The scolloping of the wood gave the furniture a charming look.
meanings.sent5: The scolloping along the edges of the book pages was intricate.
